column1: This approach is consistent with the ‘presumption of validity’ according to which
administrative action is presumed to be valid unless or until it is set aside by a court
[Hoffmann-La Roche & Co. v. Secretary of State for Trade and Industry (1975) AC
295]. However, this ‘presumption of validity’ exists pending a final decision by the
court [Lord Hoffmann in R v. Wicks (1998) AC 92 at 115, Lords Irvine LC and Steyn
in Boddington v. British Transport Police (1999) 2 AC 143 at 156 and 161, and 173-
